}} 'H1 histone family, member N, testis-specific' is a member of the histone
family of nuclear proteins which are a component of chromatin. In humans, this
protein is encoded by the H1FNT gene.

The H1FNT protein is essential for nuclear formation in spermatozoa, and is
involved in the replacement of histones with protamines during
spermiogenesis.
